Articles.Content:
Bdawg again... yes again.

Alright so here\'s the question: I\'m making a nexis engine(look it up, it\'s coolio). But a part of the project is making Xenon fuel tanks for it to run on. I\'m fine with the c# coding, I just am not schooled at all in the resources available, like the unity engine... I know nothing about that Enlighten a poor noob, if you will. I would appreciate it. Need me some Xenon... yep...
Why not just copy and reconfigure an existing model?

Very easy way to go about it, and, in the long run, exactly what I plan on doing. However, in order to make sure the part only uses xenon I need to write modules for both xenon fuel and a part that uses only xenon fuel. Besides, knowing how to do these things makes way for greater possibilities; entire scientific spirit and all of that jazzimo. If I knew where the other modules were, that would make my opus dei, because that would be a simple copy, edit, paste job. I\'ll take anything at this point.

i believe the mumech plugin allows you to create custom fuels and engines that run on that fuel : yep its here http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=8560.0 the variable family sounds like the thing you need.

i believe the mumech plugin allows you to create custom fuels and engines that run on that fuel : yep its here http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/index.php?topic=8560.0 the variable family sounds like the thing you need.

Confirming I\'m using this for my own Satellite pack and its getting improved even more!
